Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: ஈட்டம் இவறி இசைவேண்டா ஆடவர்தோற்றம் நிலக்குப் பொறை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Who lust to heap up wealth, but glory hold not dear, It burthens earth when on the stage of being they appear.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A group of miserly individuals are shown, their forms grotesquely weighted down, as if physically made of the heavy, inert gold they have hoarded.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The very ground ('Nilam') beneath their feet is groaning and cracking under their immense weight, symbolizing that they are a true burden ('Porai') to the earth.
Layered_Composition.Background: In the distance, other figures who pursue glory ('Isai') through virtuous acts are depicted as light and almost floating, causing flowers to bloom where they step, providing a stark contrast.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A literal visualization of the concept that those who only hoard wealth and do not seek honorable glory are a heavy, useless burden upon the world.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The cracking earth is the central image. The figures being physically composed of their hoard makes the metaphor visceral. The light, graceful figures in the background represent the opposite ideal.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Heavy, burdensome, oppressive, with a sense of stagnation and waste.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The misers are lit with a heavy, oppressive top-down light, in dull, metallic colors. The background figures are lit with bright, ethereal light in a vibrant palette.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Ultra-wide shot with a low angle to exaggerate the weight of the misers and the strain on the earth beneath them.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, surreal realism, with detailed ground cracking effects and textures.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dramatic, high-contrast lighting to separate the burdensome figures from the ideal ones.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Symbolic surrealism, with a strong, allegorical message.
